ocil:questionnaire.ocil:title: Ensure Default System Java Authentication and Authorization Service Is In Use

SSL Is Enabled on the ActiveMQ Web Console
All PKI Certificates Are Valid DoD Certificates
Ensure No Default User Accounts Exist
Ensure No Default Roles Exist
Ensure Only Administrators Can Modify Configuration Files
Ensure ActiveMQ Web Console is using PKI
Ensure Administrators Can Only Change Security Related Configuration Attributes
Disable or Remove Clear-Text Passwords

Disable All Unused Ports, Protocols, And services
Disable and Remove Clear-Text Passwords
Disable Or Secure Remote Access
Ensure Administrators Can Only Change Security Related Configuration Attributes
Ensure Default Roles Have Been Removed
Ensure All Downloaded Software Is Validated
Remove All Non-Essential Bundles And Features
Disable Hot Deployment
Configure JBoss Logs Number of Days Retained
Ensure Java Authentication and Authorization Service Is Configured
Disable Runtime Permissions for Deployed Applications
Ensure Default User Accounts Have Benn Removed
Configure Java Security Manager To Use An Environment Policy
Ensure Only Authorized Users Can Associate PKI Information
Ensure Log Files Are Only Accessed By Authorized Users
Enable FIPS Compliant Modules
Enable SSL On The Web Console
Ensure Only Approved Administrators Can Change System Configurations
Enable CAC Card Usage for Deployed Applications
Enable SSL When LDAP Is Configured
Secure Remote Access Via SSH
Ensure JBoss Files Have Correct Permissions
Disable All Permission for Deployed Applications
Reduce Logging To Decrease Storage Capacity Limitations
Configure LDAP To Fail Securely
Secure or Remove Web Console
Ensure Java Runtime Environment Is A Vendor Supported Version
Ensure Stored Passwords Are Encrypted
Ensure JBoss Files Are Owned By Appropriate Users
Enable The Web Console To Use PKI
Ensure Deployed Applications Have Restricted File Permissions
Ensure Only Administrators Can Modify Configuration Files
Ensure JBoss Logging Is Secured
Secure or Disable JMX Access
Enable Encrypted Passwords
Configure DoD or CNS approved PKI Class 3 and Class 4 Certificates
Ensure JBoss Process Owner Executes with Least Privilege

Enable FIPS for User and Process Authentication
Disable Socket Permissions for Deployed Applications
All PKI Certificates Are Valid DoD Certificates

ocil:boolean_question.ocil:question_text: Is it the case that JAAS is not configured?
Is it the case that passwords are not encrypted?
Is it the case that SSL is enabled in the web console?
Is it the case that PKI certificates are not DoD?
Is it the case that default JBoss users should not exist?
Is it the case that default JBoss roles should not exist?
Is it the case that non-administrators can modify files?
Is it the case that PKI is not enabled for the web console?
Is it the case that non-administrators can change configuration attributes?
Is it the case that passwords are not encrypted?
Is it the case that JBoss Fuse is not vender supported?
Is it the case that unused ports, protocols, and services have not been disabled?
Is it the case that clear-text passwords exist or are enabled?
Is it the case that remote access is not secured or disabled?
Is it the case that non-administrators are allowed to change security related attributes?
Is it the case that the default user roles still exist?
Is it the case that all JBoss software that has been downloaded is valid?
Is it the case that non-essential bundles and features have not been removed?
Is it the case that hot deployment has not been disabled?
Is it the case that JBoss logs are not configured to retain for a defined period of days?
Is it the case that JAAS is not configured or in use?
Is it the case that proper permissions are not set for java.lang.RuntimePermission for deployed applications?
Is it the case that the default user accounts still exist?
Is it the case that no policy file exists or has been configured?
Is it the case that unauthorized users can associate PKI information with security attributes?
Is it the case that log files can be accessed or viewed by any user?
Is it the case that FIPS compliant modules are not enabled?
Is it the case that SSL is not enabled on the web brower?
Is it the case that unathorized users can make system changes?
Is it the case that deployed JBoss applications do not have CAC card usage enabled?
Is it the case that LDAP is not configured to use SSL?
Is it the case that remote access is not secured?
Is it the case that JBoss file permissions are not correct?
Is it the case that proper permissions are not set for java.security.AllPermission for deployed applications?
Is it the case that logging capacity has not been reduced?
Is it the case that LDAP is not configured to fail securely?
Is it the case that the web console is not secure or removed?
Is it the case that the Java Runtime Environment is not vendor supported?
Is it the case that stored passwords are not encrypted?
Is it the case that JBoss files ownership is not correct?
Is it the case that the web console is not configured to use PKI?
Is it the case that proper permissions are not set for java.io.FilePermission for deployed applications?
Is it the case that non-administrators can modify files?
Is it the case that logging is not configured to prevent sensitive information from being revealed?
Is it the case that JMX access is not secured or disabled?
Is it the case that encrypted passwords are not enable or in use?
Is it the case that DoD or CNS approved PKI Class 3 and Class 4 certificates are not configured or in use?
Is it the case that the JBoss process owner is not executing with least privilege?
Is it the case that proper permissions are not set for java.net.NetPermission for deployed applications?
Is it the case that FIPS is not enabled or configured?
Is it the case that proper permissions are not set for java.net.SocketPermission for deployed applications?
Is it the case that certificates are not valid DoD certs?
Is it the case that the JBoss process owner has console access?
Is it the case that no appropriate minimum password expiration policy exists?
Is it the case that there are no disastor recovery procedures in place?
Is it the case that no JBoss Administrator is assigned?
Is it the case that there are no incident response procedures in place?
Is it the case that no appropriate minimum password complexity policy exists?
Is it the case that disaster recovery exercises have not been conducted?
Is it the case that incident response exercises have not been conducted?
Is it the case that no auditing policy exists?
Is it the case that no application data flow documentation exists?
Is it the case that physical protections are not in place, or they are inadequate?
Is it the case that there are no access control policy and procedures?
Is it the case that no appropriate minimum and maximum password length policy exists?
Is it the case that there are no documents for java permissions for deployed applications?
Is it the case that there are no regular backups scheduled?
